website_summaries.verdict: A great 100% polyester sleeping bag with 100% cotton fill for those who want to sleep outdoors in temps between 30 and 50 degrees Fahrenheit.
pros: No-Snag" patented zipper plows fabric away from the zipper to prevent snags
"Quick Cord System" makes fastening a cinch without tying
Added "Thermolock System" reduces heat loss through the zippers
Super plush material from top to bottom gives soft, relaxing comfort
Snaps and locks for one-person packing
You won't slide around and get sweaty
Sturdy and comfortable for the casual camper
cons: Outer shell might be sensitive and rip after time
Feels more like a medium weather sleeping bag, may be too much sleeping bag for some
Might not be suitable for serious campers who need something more heavy-duty

customer_reviews.title: Great Sleeping Bags
customer_reviews.text: I specifically purchased two of these bags since they can zip together. It was cheaper to get the two individual bags over a double/queen sized bag. They worked perfectly for our camping trip. Our cats certainly approved of them as well.
customer_reviews.author: KrisCord

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm.
customer_reviews.text: Thicker, comfortable and warm, this bag was an upgrade for my kids who outgrew their "kid" sized bags. We opted for the rectangular style as we thought our kids were still too young to want to be in a 'mummy' sack. We took this bag camping overnight when the low temperature took a surprising dip south to 40 degrees. It is rated for 32-50 and definitely fulfilled our expectations. Coleman's sleeping bags have been reliably good in our experience. We have bought Coleman bags and tents for the last 15 years and have always found them to be good value. This item is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: SnowfishBlue

customer_reviews.title: Wait....you want me to sleep..in a bag?
customer_reviews.text: When they say it's for cool weather they're not kidding. Internally this is like a thick flannel (see my -1 star comment) with thick walls and the standard woven nylon outside. Coleman isn't the lightest or highest tech...but they have mastered simple, inexpensive products that last. Construction is good, straight seams and no 'irish pennants'' all over. Length is good (I'm 5-6") and plenty of room inside it. Not a mummy bag, just standard sleeping bag shape. Now...this thing is new and the interior fabric, while heavy duty, is also stiff. Like new flannel shirt stiff. I will probably wash this (per tag) to see if it softens up any.....just cause of that I'm dinging a -1 on the stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jay RaxterTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Purchased two Sets To Zip Together!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Was usable right out of the box. I purchased two set so I could zip them together and is currently using as a comforter on top of my full size bed. Keeps me cozy warm during the night which can get quite cold. Love the colors & interior is a flannel material. My Sammy loved it too. Was also easy to roll up & loop the straps. Just wished it came with covers. Otherwise I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jl33NYCTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: but so far I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.text: My family and I camp all the time - 3 to 4 times a summer - and this was a replacement for my 10 year old coleman that had finally given up the ghost (zippers separated from the bag). I've only used this one once, but so far I'm happy with it. Kept me very warm and comfortable in temperatures that dropped down into the upper 40s the first night, but wasn't too hot when we broke out the space heater on the second night. I'm not really a fan of the strap system used to keep it rolled up, and I wish it shipped with a compression bag, but I'll solve both problems by getting my own compression bag.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Got it on sale, and I'm glad I jumped on it!
customer_reviews.text: I am SO happy with the purchase of this particular sleeping bag! Not only is it attractive, but it kept me warm this past Memorial Day weekend. I brought along a comforter in case it got too cold or I needed it while sleeping in my tent. The temperature hovered between 45 and 55 overnight, and I didn't use the comforter once (I didn't need anything additional for warmth). I was so warm in the sleeping bag I even had to unzip it to provide some cooling! And, by the way, the zipper is very sturdy and well-made - no issues there. SO happy!
customer_reviews.author: J. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Best sleeping bag on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I could sleep in it all day. When I first got it, and slept in it on the couch.. I had the best dreams of clouds! The best sleep i got! Than i took it camping, it was super windy! About 60 mph winds, basically a tornado outside the tent. And i couldn't feel a breeze in the sleeping bag! Best one on the market! I just wish it came in a carry case.
customer_reviews.author: nachelle

customer_reviews.title: Used during dog emergency and loved it!
customer_reviews.text: I had this in my closet for a while. Then my dog got a UTI and peed in the house three times in one day. We went to the vet and I tried to wash, but ended up tossing, my bedding. I pulled this out to use as a comforter just in case...I had it on my bed for over a year. It is very soft and warm underneath and cool on top. Very comfortable and very convenient! Also, it's easy to toss in the washer and dryer when needed. I totally recommend this sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.author: joedog

customer_reviews.title: Warm, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag. I don't have heating in my apartment and this has made a huge difference in helping me sleep. I'm no longer cold at night, and If I get chilly in the day, I can just climb inside and get cozy. No blanket or comforter managed to do that. Admittedly, I live in California, so can't say how well this would work at below freezing temperatures, but it's perfect for me. Very comfortable as well, and expands out to queen size bed dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as warm as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: So far i have used this bag once, 40F at night. Although long enough, I would call it a mid sized bag. A grown man can fit... but not the most roomy bag I have used. I got this bag for the temp rateing, but I did not find it to be right for 40 degrees. I think 50 to 65. The quality seems good enough, but for me, I would say its good for cool nights, and teens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inside could be softer....
customer_reviews.text: I liked the sleeping bag. Had it laundered before I used it...it’s too big to fit in a regular size washing machine. But still, the flannel lining inside seemed a bit stiff. Nevertheless, it kept me warm the two nights I slept in it. I was indoors in November at a 6,500 ft elevation (in Southern California) and it was perfect with no additional blankets.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie Reece

customer_reviews.title: Warm, comfortable and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these sleeping bags because we wanted to be able to zip two bags together, and put our 2 year old in the middle when we camped out overnight. We tested them out at a one night overnight concert at the Gorge. The temperature dropped to about 40-45 degrees at night and we all slept happily. We were warm and comfortable. They were so easy to zip together and to take apart and roll up. We were super comfortable and are pleased that we found sleeping bags we will likely use for a long, long, time!
customer_reviews.author: Jayna Lyn Dash

customer_reviews.title: If you trust in Coleman products, you can trust in this sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: Super plush and comfy! Keeps me super warm! I love the cotton interior - you don't slide around and get sweaty like in some other sleeping bag brands where the inside is all polyester. I bought two which can be zipped together to make a cozy sleeping bag for two! If you have other Coleman products, you can trust this will be just as sturdy and reliable as their other items.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag for chilly nights
customer_reviews.text: Really nice, warm sleeping bag! I really love this sleeping bag. It looks and feels nice, it’s not a cheap junk one. It’s also pretty warm. I wouldn’t want to use it in snowy weather, but I was camping out in the rain in a horse trailer with no sides. I slept with my head inside the sleeping bag to stay warm, but I was warm!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 3 season bag
customer_reviews.text: I love flannel lined sleeping bags to use as winter throw on sofa. Yea gets and stays cold and we mainly heat with wood stove so fire can go out. This bag keeps me warm And if fire going medium it's too warm in this bag. So it keep a average person warm down in mid twenties. It has a Velcro square closure pocket of about 4"x 7" roughly. It is even machine washable though might need to use commercial size washer. Hey even my lab loves to snuggle under it! Oh and it will zip together for double size which many couples.
customer_reviews.author: loveinthemist

customer_reviews.title: great through the laundry, a year later still using most of them
customer_reviews.text: We purchased about a dozen of these for campground usage, we wash them daily and they are very strong. We've had two that have lost zippers, but it has a very reinforced zipper thingy. The outer shell, is a bit sensitive, and can rip easily. But it doesn't really bunch up during laundry and that I am very happy about.
customer_reviews.author: Jello

customer_reviews.title: Good but much thicker than expected
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine little sleeping bag but I wouldn't exactly call it cool weather. It's surprisingly thick and heavy. Quite a bit of filler. Not compact at all. More of a medium weather sleeping bag, and one where portability is not an issue. I like the quality. Just wasn't expecting so much sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: G. FarnsworthTop Contributor: Board Games

customer_reviews.title: A Decent Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: It's a great sleeping bag for the price. The best part is that it has a 100% cotton flannel liner, is machine washable, and the tie-up system is much easier than my last bag. The only downside is that it's not as thick as I'd hoped. I wanted a thicker, cushy sleeping bag, which it why I got a cool/cold weather one. I did find a cheat if you're having trouble tying it up: just hook the hook on the other loop, instead of threading it through like the instructions. The ropes are already tight enough that it won't come apart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: On the narrow side
customer_reviews.text: Only used for two nights in an indoor cool setting. Found it a little on the narrow side, but good for a tight space... I am 5'6", and I could stretch out with no problem. For wide bodied and taller persons, I would recommend another bag. Otherwise, fit my use very well. Also, this does NOT have a carry handle attached on the bag. Wish it had. Would be a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Can be tandem!
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag. You can put two of them together to make a tandem bag. Keeps my daughter and I warm on cold tent nights.
customer_reviews.author: R. Nico

customer_reviews.title: Cozy and Washable
customer_reviews.text: I love this sleeping bag so much this is the second one I've ordered. The first one has been with me for about 6 years and is still goinf strong. The fleece is cozy, It's perfect for car camping when the weather's not too cold (60s at night, aka Los Angeles fall) and two of them can zip together for couples, if desired. Washed/dried it in the machine a few times with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kids love them and stays warm camping
customer_reviews.text: Our kids love them. The fabric on the inside is a nice cloth for keeping them from sliding around too. We used them camping recently, at 6300' in the mountains, where it got down to high-40s/low-50s each night - they slept great and were plenty warm. TIP -- Wash and machine dry it once or twice before using the first time... it will make the inside fabric softer AND fluff up the insulation.
customer_reviews.author: vipab

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good quality for the price. Somewhat plush and will get me through backyard camp outs with my kids.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri L.

customer_reviews.title: Warm and nice green color but no bag
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and warm. I love the green color as well. The only thing I thought was odd was that it did not come with a bag to carry or store it in, to keep the dirt out. I revisited the listing and reviews to make sure it didn't come with one. I'll need to search around for one I guess.
customer_reviews.author: MelissaBee

customer_reviews.title: Depends what you need it for
customer_reviews.text: This is a big sleeping bag, I mean it kept me warm throughout the night when my alternator went out when I was driving in the mtns. But it is heavy and fairly large to carry when hiking. If they could make this thinner or lighter without compromising the insulation quality, it'd be perfect. NOT good for hiking with. Great for short distance camping.
customer_reviews.author: Ethereal Entropy

customer_reviews.title: NOT FLANNEL as described - terrible quality cotton lining
customer_reviews.text: Terrible, scratchy, cotton lining. Smells like chemicals. Very unhappy. Made in China.
customer_reviews.author: KAN

customer_reviews.title: Great, but needs a stuff sack.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been able to use this in cooler weather yet, but it does hold in heat. I can't wait to use it when I go camping. The only drawback was the strings to tie it up with are a little to tight to use. I felt like the bag was going to rip. So I bought a stuff sack to keep it closed instead. The XL Liberty Mountain Stuff Sack was a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jo-Jo

customer_reviews.title: I would like to give this product a higher star count
customer_reviews.text: I would like to give this product a higher star count, as it is very comfortable, but after several uses the inside coloring die started to bleed off on to my skin, After two washes, (hand wash and air dry ) the die is still coming off onto the skin. I dont know if I got a bad bag but as comfortable as the bag is it would have a higher rating if the dye did not come off.
customer_reviews.author: KIJO SMITH

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice, cool fabric that doesn't scratch or catch like ...
customer_reviews.text: We've owned this sleeping bag for a few weeks now, and have used it several times. It's a nice, cool fabric that doesn't scratch or catch like some do. I would buy this again. The color is vibrant and attractive and the plow zipper has completely eliminated the common problem of zippers getting stuck on the fabric. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: angelinamax

customer_reviews.title: basic bag with stiff cotton lining
customer_reviews.text: It is what it is. A pretty inexpensive slightly scratchy lined sleeping bag. Not uncomfortable but not as soft as a pricier version would be. I bought mine used and felt it was worth the money but would not have paid more. It is perfect for sleeping especially chilly mid summer nights in the mountain. Its not too big so plan for one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonophile

customer_reviews.title: Very cozy inside
customer_reviews.text: The fabric on the inside is wonderful and soft, but the outer fabric wasn't as thick as I might have expected. Coleman makes such great stuff I thought it would be thicker. Nevertheless it's about average and is really cozy. Worth the price
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Quality, soft, well-designed bags
customer_reviews.text: These were great on our recent camping trip. We bought two and used them as a double bag for two adults and an infant. The weather dropped into the high 30’s and you could tell that pushed the limit on these bags, but the fabric was soft and comfy and as long as we were all inside it was pretty toasty in the middle (the edges got cold). They didn’t rip or tear. The zipper has a red part so you know where to connect the two bags together. These will be our bags for a while to come and I feel great about the quality and longevity of these.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G. Carner

customer_reviews.title: You will need a compression bag if you plan on hiking with this
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag is HUGE and thick. It's great for sleeping and it's a very cute pattern. The material doesn't feel scratchy like other Coleman bags feel. I do wish it came with a compression bag or a tad bit smaller just because it's massive for packing on to go. It's definitely more ideal for just camping than hiking/on the go.
customer_reviews.author: mochi

customer_reviews.title: Light and warm.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3 sleeping bag I’m buying from this brand and I love them all but I gave it 4 star since the inner layer is cotton. The other 2 have fleece inner layer and that makes it softer, nicer and warmer.
customer_reviews.author: safana

customer_reviews.title: It is not as bright a green as illustrated by he still really liked it. The lining was soft and warm and ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this. It is not as bright a green as illustrated by he still really liked it. The lining was soft and warm and it kept him cosy except on the coldest nights (24 deg F) when we supplemented it with blankets - mind you it is not rated for those temperatures. The bag would zip better if Coleman had rounded the corner of the bag rather than just sewing the zip on a curve - I have never seen a bag done this way before and it made zipping it in the dark very difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shorter than advertised
customer_reviews.text: The length of this bag is supposed to be 75in, however the one I received is only about 70in. I'm about 5'6", so it still fits me ok, but I wouldn't recommend this bag to anyone taller than me. That's pretty sloppy manufacturing to be off by a whole 5 inches. Plus, the box it came in was mangled. Probably more Amazon's fault than Coleman's, but c'mon, guys. Otherwise, it's a nice bag. Kept me plenty warm for a summer night in southern California mountains. The inner material is a little stiff but feels nice, and the stitching and roll-up strings seem sturdy after a few uses. For a casual, once-or-twice-a-year camper, it's just right.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: comfortable sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I love this one. I bought two together. this and another. this one is very comfortable. the flannel works for these. they can be opened as a blanket. yet, the zipper is a bit annoying if done this way. not completely unbearable, just slightly.annoying. other than that, this is a very good sleeping bag. my son likes to use it in the house, as do I.
customer_reviews.author: Wright Path Technologies

customer_reviews.title: One Thing Missing
customer_reviews.text: Coleman must be trying to cut back on costs. Our previous "same" sleeping bag came with an outside protective cover. Not this one. Come on Coleman - the outside cover also serves as protection when stored.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger 185

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable sleeping spring through early fall
customer_reviews.text: This is a good late spring through early fall sleeping bag. Its comfortable and light weight. We enjoyed the phone size pocket at the top of the sleeping bag. They are easy to wash and well made.
customer_reviews.author: The Hudson’s

customer_reviews.title: Great value for your money
customer_reviews.text: I've been out on a 3 day camping wherein the temperature dropped about 40 degrees in the middle of the night and this product works as expected. I love the inside pocket where you can stow away your headlamp or be innovative and pocket in your mp3 player too. The zipper didn't snag and this sleeping bag is much smaller than some other sleeping bag I saw others brought to the trip. I suggest getting a sleeping mat for a comfortable night's sleep, a cheap one that works as expected is the. Overall I had only hoped it came with a bag so it can be packed even much smaller. :)
customer_reviews.author: Bazinga!

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Not Too Hot
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable bag. I have not had a sleeping bag of my own since i was a child and spent a while finding one within the lower price range that would offer what I wanted. So far this bag has only been used inside during the spring. Bag itself did not get too hot or too cold, probably would be best in an environment below the mid 70's.
customer_reviews.author: Emmy

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This arrived the day if our family camp out. It kept me warm but not to hot. It’s a great quality. I plan on purchasing another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Kniss

customer_reviews.title: Since I plan to use infrequently it was good buy for my use
customer_reviews.text: I used it recent retreat where we were in cabins. We used the sleeping bag as our bedding instead bringing sheets and blankets. Since I plan to use infrequently it was good buy for my use. I normally camp in south during spring, summer, and fall so I think it was good purchase and modestly priced.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Fraticelli

customer_reviews.title: Not the warmest
customer_reviews.text: We were still very cold. It was 50 degrees and this did not keep us warm. Glad we brought our down comforter too. Good for warmer nights.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: They were warm enough into the 40 only one night where it got colder did I need an extra blanket but then it was perfect! They a
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for a camping trip for my husband and I. They were warm enough into the 40 only one night where it got colder did I need an extra blanket but then it was perfect! They are a bit of a pain to roll up but we had room in our car to fit them... so if your tight on space get something smaller otherwise these worked wonderfully. The color was definitely brighter green then the picture if that matters.
customer_reviews.author: taitfamTop Contributor: Cross-Stitch

customer_reviews.title: decent sleeping bags.
customer_reviews.text: i bought these for christmas for my kids. they said they are warm and comfy and like that there is a spot for their flashlight. i don't like the string to hold it when rolled and i wish they came with a bag to store them in. but for the price i got them at they aren't bad.
customer_reviews.author: Teeshann

customer_reviews.title: used frequently
customer_reviews.text: I got these for our large family to go camping with about 6 months ago. They are cloth inside which has a much nicer feel than the synthetic outer covering. My kids ended up using them a lot. In a small house we all sleep in one room and these are much easier to put away for the day other bedding. For the amount of use they've gotten, they are rather durable and still comfortable. Easy to zip up, no fabric ripping, easy to roll up or fold. Fits in the washer and line dries nicely. *UPDATE* Still using them regularly 8 years later.
customer_reviews.author: madhavadas

customer_reviews.title: ... in Maine even in early spring and late fall comfortably --- a had feat to accomplish
customer_reviews.text: Bought two as gifts and both now go camping in Maine even in early spring and late fall comfortably --- a had feat to accomplish. I wasn't surprised though because I bought a Coleman sleeping bag very similar decades ago and am still using it and it is as toasty warm and comfortable to lie on now as it was when my husband got it for me for Christmas. It's been on many camping trips and works well on the floor when I'm a guest where there's no beds or couch free.
customer_reviews.author: MonaK

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag for the money.
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these already that we've been using for a little over a year. They work good for us. Buying another one for our daughter or extra camper. We use these in our popup camper instead of bedding. Sleep comfortable in the 40's. We add a blanket on top for 30deg sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Ross

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight and Warm
customer_reviews.text: Just right. Warm, soft flannel lining keeps you toasty during nights below 20 degrees. The zipper never sticks, even with frequent use, and the shell is durable. There are fasteners that make this bag easy to roll, pack and hump on walks of ten or twenty miles. It's perfect for persons under 5 feet 10 inches tall who weigh less than 180 pounds. Note: you'll have to go to the dry cleaners to clean this bag, which can pinch the wallet, but it's worth the expense.
customer_reviews.author: Carrumba

customer_reviews.title: It was perfect for the temperature ( nights in the 40's) and ...
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled with my sleeping bag! I used it in Maine in the spring and in the summer. It was perfect for the temperature ( nights in the 40's) and felt very cozy. The color is really pretty. I plan to purchase a compression sac for it. I can roll it pretty small for its size - but when I put the straps around the sleeping bag, it puffs up a bit. This is not a big deal to me. I would highly recommend this comfortable sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: it is ok.
customer_reviews.text: it block most of the cold temperature. next time i will buy some other sleeping bag that can be put into its own bag. This one doesn't come with a bag for storing it. when store away for next time, it is not convenience to store. But the quanlity is good
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia

customer_reviews.title: Not too warm, not too cold
customer_reviews.text: My husband needed a sleeping bag for coolish weather for an upcoming boat race. He ordered this and pointed out that we could zip our cool weather sleeping bags together to keep each other warm. There are several reasons this will never work: 1. Mine is a much better color and it's prejudiced against florescent apple-lime green bags. 2. I keep my socks in the bottom of my sleeping bag. 3. He steals the blankets when it gets cold. These are great sleeping bags, really perfect for the boat, especially in changing weather situations.
customer_reviews.author: Trouble

customer_reviews.title: Great cotton lining and temperature control but bulky with a fragile tie-up design
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great temperature control that can handle the cold and the comfy cotton lining avoids that plastic feeling. Cons: The string tie is fragile and annoying. The sheer force required to compress the bag makes it an obvious rip spot so I am looking for a big plastic bag or stuff sack for it. The bag is also pretty bulky and just a bit short so would not recommend for people 6" tall or more.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works when camping in Big Bear
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoyed this sleeping bag! I went camping in Big Bear, CA and this is the first sleeping bag I have purchased! I was worried about the material since it was such a good price but its really kept me warm all night. It didn't keep me too hot nor let any cold in, its was just right! I'm 5'4 and I could literally push myself to the bottom of the sleeping bag and have my head covered which was just fine because it kept my head and ears warm. I would definitely recommend this if you have a tight budget and want/need a sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.author: Mayte

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I washed this sleeping bag when I got it. I used the gentle cycle. The stuffing still got all bunched up. On the FIRST washing. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy W.

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the price - kept me warm below freezing temp.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned about this bag for colder weather, but after a night in 30 degrees AND having left the top of the tent vented (an accident I only discovered at dawn), I was snug as a bug. The only critique I would have is that the cordage used to roll the bag is difficult. After several tries I finally managed to get it, but the bag was lumpy and shifted loose during pack up.
customer_reviews.author: AvidConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Good summer bag
customer_reviews.text: The zipper guides and the ability to zip together two bags into one double bag make this a good car camping bag for summer and fall. Not the true flannel that I remember from my childhood, but a good facsimile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than blankets!
customer_reviews.text: I originally got this as a backup of sorts, to make sure I had something to keep me warm no matter where I was in the house, or even if I left the house and remembered to bring it. Since I got it, it has completely taken the place of all blankets on my bed. It's been around 60-80F most of the time I've used it, but it could definitely work well in colder temperatures, I feel. For warmer temperatures, I use a bed sheet instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was a little cold on my camping trip when the temps got into the low 40s; if it got any colder I'd have to use a blanket inside. Otherwise I like the soft material, the zipper works very well and it's easy enough to roll up and secure with the tie strings (it's a cord+clip system that I found easier than tying a knot when trying to hold it tight). Five stars for an excellent price / performance ratio.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kim

customer_reviews.title: The zippers worked nicely, and it was easy to roll
customer_reviews.text: My husband picked out this sleeping bag for me. The lining is soft, and there is a cute little pocket right inside to store things (probably only big enough for a set of headphones, definitely not a smartphone). I cannot say much about keeping you warm, as we camped last month during 90 degree heat. The zippers worked nicely, and it was easy to roll.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Day

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Value For a Casual Camper
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and comfortable for the casual camper. We camped in the mountains of Colorado and Montana, and stayed warm enough during the chilly summer evenings with some additional light layering (a fleece, hat, and scarf are really helpful if you don't have a mummy bag). My daughter is in Girl Scouts, and I think these should serve us well and last us quite a few years.
customer_reviews.author: S. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not 30 degree weather sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag was really nice (looks wise) and we were able to zip two up pretty easily to make a double sleeper but.. we were it 30 something degree weather and it was cold! They next night it was a little warmer so it wasn't so bad. I think these are suited better for mid-forties and up. For anyone still shopping, I see the benefit of the mummy style sleeping bags because they keep the cold air out. This one was nice and roomy but that makes it easy for the cold air to get in.
customer_reviews.author: alejandra

customer_reviews.title: Best Value For The Price
customer_reviews.text: Best value for the buck I've found. I also like the inner lining of this sleeping bag which is more like flannel than that other weird material I've found in other similar priced sleeping bags. I don't know what that other material is on other sleeping bags, but it catches my toe nails as I try to slide my legs in and it and it's extremely annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for pro stuff then this piece won't do it. But if you are looking for regular use and not wanting to spend too much then this is good. I have only two complaints though. The packing mechanism is really awkward and they don't give a bag with this product. I am going to have to buy a bag separately. I still like it because the bag itself works well. Especially the cotton lining doesn't make you feel mummified in plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Burlingamer

customer_reviews.title: Not really big enough for a grown man
customer_reviews.text: I tried out this bag in the living room and I was suprised at how snug it was. I'm 5'11" which I realize is the top end of the scale for this bag but it was not the length that got me. It was how snug it was all the way around my body. I don't guess that will be too much of a problem but I expected a little more room. Maybe less space means less air to heat so it keeps you warmer, I don't know. I plan on trying this out in some roughly 40 degree temps this weekend. I'll post an update after.
customer_reviews.author: April Scarafino

customer_reviews.title: It does not feel nice. It feels cheapo
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I'm several places it said the inside lining was 100% cotton. This is FALSE. The lining is 80% 20% polyester. It does not feel nice. It feels cheapo.
customer_reviews.author: J. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: I really like this bag
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bag, but the flannel material is scratchier than I was hoping for. I have sensory issues and can't handle the smooth feeling of most sleeping bags so I opted for this one because of the flannel. It's okay, but my husband's (Coleman Oak Point Large Cool-Weather Sleeping Bag) has a softer material. I'd switch but he needs the large size!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie St Jean

customer_reviews.title: Love it very warm
customer_reviews.text: I love Coleman brand. This sleeping bag was brought for my mom when we went camping it was very warm because at night it could get cold.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Hayward

customer_reviews.title: Got for it.  Multifunctional, comfortable, lightweight, quick to roll up, and easily compacted to store and carry.
customer_reviews.text: I have found this sleeping bag perfect for keeping warm and cozy indoors for sleepovers. Opens up flat to function as a makeshift comforter or even a nice soft picnic blanket. When used as a sleeping bag, the flannel liner cuff overlaps the top edge, which adds a nice soft touch texture for the face and neck. It think would be ideal for individuals approximately no taller than 5'10" in height. Zipper has never snagged. Overall, I am happy with purchase: affordable, comfortable, lightweight, quick to roll up, and easily compacted to store and carry.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Recommended: warm and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my regular blanket. Its so soft and warm, super lightweight. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Top quality at bottom dollar!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a Christmas present for one of my nephews who just joined Boy Scouts this year. He loves the color green! Upon arrival, the shade of green is actually a bit darker than what is shown in the picture, which I feel is actually a good thing. To my surprise, this sleeping bag came in a box, which will make it a bit easier to wrap. I know my nephew will love it, and, as always, the Amazon price is unbeatable!
customer_reviews.author: mdgrl79

customer_reviews.title: Good, basic sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a good basic sleeping bag. My husband and I do yearly camping trips in the summer, and these work just fine. It usually gets about 40 degrees at night where we go, and we were warm enough in these. The only complaint I have is they are terrible to try to roll tightly. It just doesn't happen. I have rolled many sleeping bags in my day, and this is one of the worst for rolling up and staying together. But that doesn't really effect it's function as a sleeping bag, so overall I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: drewmw

customer_reviews.title: The strap broke the first time I tried to use it.
customer_reviews.text: The tie strap broke the first time I tried to roll it back up. As soon as it arrived we opened up the sleeping bag to check it out. The bag seems nice and should do fine in mild weather. After we were done looking at it, I rolled it back up and as I was pulling the small attached tie strap to keep it rolled up, it broke. Instead of sending it back, I went to REI and bought a 30 Liter stuff sack which is the prefect size for this bag. After getting the stuff sack I like it much better. In summary The bag itself seems good but the tie strap is really small and garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Vinson

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, Cold
customer_reviews.text: Sleeping bag is comfy and well made. The 30-50 degree rating can't be right though. I took it out in the 30's and it did not keep me warm at all and I don't mind being cold but it was freezing. Other than that its a good comfy sleeping bag, just don't take it below probably 45.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's like stealing considering the price
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap and quite warm even in 40°F. Easy to wash and survives the harsh dryer. The only downside is that I found it to be a bit small lengthwise so you're probably going to have to bend your knees to sleep in this one. For comparison my height is 5'9. Also don't expect it to have a lot of padding, some people may find it too thin but I find it thick enough. Then again I can sleep on concrete.
customer_reviews.author: jinha

customer_reviews.title: Good sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Perfect warmth but the temperature was in 30’s I am not sure about below that , but we don’t camp if it is below freezing so it works for us best. Bought two more of this .
customer_reviews.author: vijay

customer_reviews.title: Wow, how did you make this?
customer_reviews.text: I'm very particular when it comes to sleeping bags. I don't like the sticky ones, the heavy ones, the light ones. It's almost like I felt, I'd have to get it custom made to not be cribbing. This, is better than what I could have got made. It's not sticky, comfortable, insulated but not unnecessarily hot. Just perfection.
customer_reviews.author: jitesh

customer_reviews.title: I've used this for camping and keep it in the ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for camping and keep it in the car for emergencies. It is durable and warm. I do wish it came with a little portable storage bag, because binding it with the cords when rolled up doesn't work well. I've got it rolled up and stuffed into a pillow case.
customer_reviews.author: Cinnabun

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable, warm
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, about the same as the Coleman Oak Point Large Cool-Weather Sleeping Bag but if you're a taller-than-average, curvy woman you'll not find much extra room for stretching but it's still quite comfortable... maybe because the kids kept trying to squeeze in. For solitary use it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag, needs a sack for storage.
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag was perfect for my 10-year-old to talk to summer camp. He loved it and it will fit him for many years. It also kept him warm, which was a huge plus. I did subtract one star though because it is really difficult to roll it up and keep it held together with the string. It kept popping off of the small clasp. A sack to hold it would have been better.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Very warm and cozy for night with temperature around 40F
customer_reviews.author: Armun

customer_reviews.title: ... flannel inside it is micro fabric which I don't like. It was more like a cocoon
customer_reviews.text: This is not flannel inside it is micro fabric which I don't like. It was more like a cocoon.No room to turn back and forth. How ever I am giving it a 3 because it kept me snug and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde Rose

customer_reviews.title: It does not come with a traveling bag
customer_reviews.text: The color and comfort is nice but its a pain to store, role up and travel with because it does NOT COME with a travel bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: My daughter love it. There is no cover for this sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: jinjeong

customer_reviews.title: thin, cozy and easy!
customer_reviews.text: Update - 5 years later...still loving this sleeping bag. Went looking for my original order to order my bf a new bag and couldn't believe it has been 5 years since I purchased it! Great investment and might be the last bag I buy! I love this sleeping bag! It is warm but not thick and bulky, and is the easiest sleeping bag to roll back up I've ever owned. The packaging and timing of shipping was also better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: ERinger

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: One thing I've always hated about sleeping bags is that they're so tight around your feet if you're a side sleeper or if you get hot feet. This bag has a zipper on the bottom that opens up so you can let your feet breathe! It also has a super easy way of rolling it up without tying strings. Flannel interior is plenty warm. There is a small pocket sewed to the inside top of the bag for keeping small items if needed. I couldn't have been any happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful camping bag
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these bags several years ago and loved them. They wash well, are very comfortable and are very warm. We just ordered two more for upcoming camping trips so all four of us have quality sleeping bags. No more arguing over who gets to use the nicest sleeping bags!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag, but loud
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sleeping bag for my daughter, and I would have given it five stars except that it kept me awake much of the night on our camping trip. I have a Coleman bag with a cloth covering, which doesn't make any noise when I move. The nylon cover, however, sounded like squirrels rustling in leaves everytime she moved at all. A comfortable bag and it seems well made, but the noise makes me crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Newman

customer_reviews.title: I used to hate Coleman products.
customer_reviews.text: I used to hate Coleman products. They break so easily. It has been 15 year I stop buying any Coleman products. But a lot of amazon's customers giving 4 star rating got my attention. So I give Coleman company one more chance. I am glad I did. The quality of this sleeping bag is very practical. Well done Coleman company!
customer_reviews.author: Y.Andrew

customer_reviews.title: beware washing instructions
customer_reviews.text: Says that you have to wash and dry it in commercial units and also that you must add fabric softener to the wash cycle. I washed it in a top-loading HE machine set on "bulky" and dried it on low in a large-capacity dryer with careful attention to taking it out and turning it around a few times. If you don't have an HE washer and large capacity dryer you will have to go to the laundromat.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M.

customer_reviews.title: BIG and WARM sleeping bag. I plan on using ...
customer_reviews.text: BIG and WARM sleeping bag. I plan on using this for winter hiking, but it might be a little too large. The product itself is very cozy with the quilted inside.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Good price,great quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a nylon bag which will be going to Goodwill.We use our bags unzipped and it's like teflon .This bag is flannel lined,warm & just right for sleeping on cool nights.To any Vets who know that All Duffle Bags look like Duffle Bags you can believe the reviews and 5 stars this product has.Pictures & Companies lie so the consumer is our best source for facts and they have reviewed this bag honestly.Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: The sleeping bag is great for light duty and mild weather
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag is great for light duty and mild weather, I chose it because of the natural fiber lining. But seriously, the no-bag issue is a bigger deal than I thought. It is truly annoying, exacerbated by the way the built in straps are nearly impossible to tie up. I don't know how not including a stuff sack that would be worth at most $5 was skipped by Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Zorn

customer_reviews.title: Puffy sleeping bag with warm flannel inside!
customer_reviews.text: Nice warm sleeping bag. I dont know about you but I am always cold when I am camping so I dont know if there is a sleeping bag on the earth that would keep me toasty. However this is a very nice sleeping bag. My only complaint is I wish it would pack down a little smaller. It takes up a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: Mussha

customer_reviews.title: This sleeping bag does not come with container bag
customer_reviews.text: I have order this sleeping bag and I like it very much, but I was little disappointed not knowing this sleeping bag does not come with container bag. I have ordered 3 other sleeping bags by same company and they all came with it. I don't know why this sleeping bag doesn't come with and wish it did so I can carry it around with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Peter K

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: The bag works great. It is long enough (I am 5'10") with a little room to spare. It keeps me warm (though it hasn't been very cold in the month I have used it. The bag's interior is very comfortable and It rolls up very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, albeit basic sleeping bag for tent camping ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good, albeit basic sleeping bag for tent camping in Florida. Keeps my partner warm when it's cold and even cool when it is hot. She uses it on top of an Alps Mountaineering Self-Inflating pad and sleeps like a rock. Does not include a stuff sack though! There are better options out there comfort-wise, but for the price (less than $25!) you can't really beat it.
customer_reviews.author: BeeDee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sleeping bag down to 40 degrees
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sleeping bag. It was very comfortable and the lining sort of flannel like was warm. I used it so far only once in a tent in 42 degrees with long pajamas and stayed warm all night. I think it's a great product for the price so I bought two.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Nice for kids camp outs.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sleeping bag. The inside fabric is soft and it rolls up easily. My Boy Scout and Girl Scout take turns using this on camping trips and it's easy enough for them to roll up and fasten the rope by themselves.
customer_reviews.author: TillyFatCat

product_meta.title: Coleman Green Valley Cool Weather Adult Sleeping Bag
product_meta.description:
Sleep comfortably when camping in temperatures as low as 30°F with the Coleman Palmetto Cool-Weather Sleeping Bag. Featuring a brushed polyester cover, cozy cotton flannel liner, and a ComfortCuff that surrounds your face in soft, warm fabric, this sleeping bag is ideal for cool nights in the great outdoors. Fiberlock construction keeps the insulation from shifting, reducing cold spots and increasing durability, and a Thermolock draft tube helps prevent heat from escaping through the zipper. The 2-way patented ZipPlow system plows fabric away from the zipper to prevent snags and frustration. When it's time to pack up, this lightweight backpacking sleeping bag rolls and fastens quickly with its Roll Control design and Quick Cord system. This adult sleeping bag can accommodate most people up to 5 feet 11 inches tall and is machine washable for easy cleaning.

AMAZON.COM
Ideal for cool weather camping where the temperature range is between 30 and 50 degrees Fahrenheit, the Coleman Green Valley sleeping bag is durably constructed of a polyester cover with soft, cozy cotton-flannel lining. Three pounds of ColeTherm insulation keep you comfortable throughout the night, and the bag measures 33-by-75 inches (W x D), fitting most campers up to five feet, 11 inches tall. QuickCord storage means fast, tie-free closure of the sleeping bag when it's time to strike camp. 

 The Green Valley sleeping bag includes Coleman's ComfortSmart technology, meaning it's full of features to keep you warm and comfortable, such as: 

 * ZipPlow: Prevents zipper snags by plowing fabric away from zipper 
 * Roll Control: Locks bag in place for easier rolling 
 * FiberLock: Prevents insulation from shifting, increasing durability 
 * ThermoLock: Reduces heat loss through the zipper, keeping you warmer 
 * Certified Temperature Rating: Independently tested for temperature accuracy 
 * Zipper Glide Tailoring: Allows smooth zipper operation around the corner 
 * Comfort Cuff: Surrounds your face with softness 

 The Coleman Limited Warranty
Coleman has been in business for more than 100 years, and continues to produce high-quality, affordable tents, lanterns, table-top stoves, and more. All Coleman products have a warranty against defects in material and workmanship, and the Green Valley sleeping bag includes a limited five-year manufacturer's warranty. 

 About Coleman Outdoor Products
More than 100 years ago, an entrepreneurial young man named W.C. Coleman had an idea for manufacturing better lanterns in Wichita, Kansas. A century later, Coleman's current catalog features a wide-ranging array of products that make spending time outside a pleasure. The company crafts coolers that keep food and drinks cold for days, airbeds that are comfortable and won't deflate during the night, a complete line of bright and long-lasting LED lights, powerful portable grills that cook with an authentic open-grill flame, and more.
